alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Beaufort and Pamlico Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grantsboro, or 10 miles east of James City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lowland, Florence, Janeiro, Grantsboro, Whortonsville, Maribel, Nc Pamlico, Merritt, Minnesott Beach Ferry, Bayboro, Alliance, Arapahoe, Minnesott Beach, Stonewall, Vandemere and Mesic. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
